text: Peggy Ann "Peg" Lautenschlager (November 22, 1955 â€“ March 31, 2018) was an American attorney and politician. He was the first chair of the Wisconsin Ethics Commission.Mark Sommerhauser. "Ethics Commission chairwoman Peg Lautenschlager resigns". Wisconsin State Journal, April 8, 2017. Accessed November 19, 2017."Peg Lautenschlater, Brian Bell chosen to lead new ethics commission". Wisconsin State Journal. Lautenschlager was Attorney General of the State of Wisconsin from January 3, 2003 to January 3, 2007. She replaced fellow Democrat Jim Doyle when Doyle was elected Governor of Wisconsin in 2002. Lautenschlager was the first woman in history to have been elected Wisconsin Attorney General. Lautenschlager died on March 31, 2018 at her home in Fond du Lac, Wisconsin of breast and bone cancer, aged 62.Former Wisconsin AG and FDL Native Peg Lautenschlager Dies, KFIZ.com; accessed April 1, 2018.Rick Barrett and Annysa Johnson. "Former state Rep. and Wisconsin Attorney General Peg Lautenschlager has died". Milwaukee Journal-Sentinel, March 31, 2018. ==References== Category:1955 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Cancer deaths in Wisconsin Category:Deaths from breast cancer Category:Deaths from bone cancer Category:Wisconsin attorneys general Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians Category:People from Fond du Lac, Wisconsin
title: Peg Lautenschlager
